title: Wolves stun Manchester City to leave champions eight points behind leaders Liverpool
text:
Manchester City have coped incredibly well with the loss of big players to injury in recent seasons but the long term absence of Aymeric Laporte may prove a bridge too far even for this side. Of all the players to lose, Laporte would probably have been the last on Pep Guardiola’s list and, after an afternoon when a magnificent Wolverhampton Wanderers brutally exposed City’s Achilles heel thanks to two late goals from Adama Traore to hand Liverpool a significant advantage in the title race, those feelings will only have been reinforced.

After just eight games, Jurgen Klopp’s side have an eight point lead, the biggest any team has enjoyed in the Premier League era at this stage. City clawed back a seven point deficit last term to win the title but this will be a different challenge.

They may have been without Kevin De Bruyne for long periods then but they still had Laporte anchoring the back line and, for as long as he is missing and Nicolas Otamendi is manning the defence, City will be vulnerable.

Perhaps the loss of Laporte with a knee injury until March would not have proved quite as costly had City been willing to cough up an additional £20 million to sign Harry Maguire but they opted against doing so and the wisdom of that now looks questionable. John Stones’s return from injury after the international break cannot come soon enough, although the England centre-half has been having his own struggles.
